tasks.title: Define company data model
tasks.description: Write a plain-English product spec for a company data model. The model needs: company name, company ID, sector, CEO persona name, chip balance (3 accounts: savings, spending, investment), creation date, and status (active/suspended). Describe each field, its purpose, constraints, and relationships. This is a spec document, NOT code.

tasks.title: Design company schema
tasks.description: Based on the product spec from task-001, define the Convex database schema for the companies table. Use defineTable with Convex validators. Include companyId as root entity, all fields from the spec, and appropriate indexes. Follow the pattern: every table gets companyId for row-level isolation (except companies table itself which IS the root).

tasks.title: Review spec and schema for consistency
tasks.description: Validate that task-001 spec and task-002 schema are consistent. Check: all fields from spec exist in schema, types are correct, indexes make sense for likely queries, no fields are missing. Return PASS or FAIL with specific issues.
